DOC.brief_summary: Spinal canal anesthesia mark commonly use method cesarean section . Traditional spinal anesthesia may cause post-dural puncture headache low back pain.Plenty parturients undergo anticoagulation therapy.They may force accept general anesthesia order avoid epidural hematoma.Therefore , propose minimally invasive spinal anesthesia .
DOC.brief_title: Minimally Invasive Lumbar Aneasthesia Used Cesarean Section
DOC.detailed_description: Traditional group patient receive cut type 22 gauge needle , minimally invasive group patient receive pen type 27 gauge needles.Patients blind intervention allocation . Spinal anesthesia perform standardized technique . Lumbar puncture perform interspace ( L3-4 L2-3 ) patient lateral decubitus position . After free flow cerebrospinal fluid needle tip verify , 2ml ropivacaine inject . We record puncture situation , anesthesia plane measure post-dural puncture headache , post-operative back pain epidural hematoma .
DOC.criteria: 1. puerpera accept anticoagulation therapy 2 . American society anesthesiologist ( ASA ) classification I II level 3 . Willing participate study sign informed consent 4. pregnancy least 37 week 1. platelet count less 50*100000000 2. International Normalized Ratio 1.5 3. site puncture infection 4. intracranial hypertension 5. lumbar spine spinal cord disorder
